sentence.Network_en: I had a presentiment that he represented a danger to me.

sentence.Network_en: He had a presentiment of disaster.

list.abs: Soapy followed the man with a presentiment that luck would again run against him ., 索皮跟随着那人 , 却有预感幸运将再次与他背道而驰.
third , build up realty presentiment system from the angle of financial crisis ;, 其三建立金融危机角度的房地产预警体系;
She often has an ominous presentiment ., 她时时有一种不祥的预感.
I have a propitious presentiment that we will have a wonderful beginning .我有一种吉祥的预感，咱们肯定会有一个非常好的开端。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from obsolete French présentiment

entry.def: A presentiment is a feeling that a particular event, for example someone's death, will soon take place.

example.ex: I had a presentiment that he represented a danger to me...
example.tran: 我预感他会给我带来危险。

example.ex: He had a presentiment of disaster.

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of evil to come;

sentences.sentence: "the lawyer had a presentiment that the judge would dismiss the case"

auth_sentence.content: A curious, and apparently unconscious, presentiment of death.
auth_sentence.res_content: A curious, and apparently unconscious, presentiment of death.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A curious, and apparently unconscious, presentiment of death.

auth_sentence.content: Both...felt a presentiment that they would never see him again.
auth_sentence.res_content: Both...felt a presentiment that they would never see him again.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Both...felt a presentiment that they would never see him again.

auth_sentence.content: Why did all of this come to me as a presentiment?
auth_sentence.res_content: Why did all of this come to me as a presentiment?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why did all of this come to me as a presentiment?

stems_affixes.word_buile: consent[n.&v.[to]同意,赞成,答应]+ient=ent表形容词→adj.同意的, 无异议的
dissent[v.不同意,持异议]+sion→dissension意见不合
scent=sent感觉→ n.气味，香味；香水 v.嗅猎；察觉
sent感觉+ence表名词→根据感觉来判断→判决，宣判
con共同+sent感觉→共同感觉→同意
as一再,一样+sent感觉→一样的感觉→赞同
dis分开+sent感觉→感觉不合→不同意
scent=sent感觉→ n.气味，香味；香水 v.嗅猎；察觉
